data.title: Ely Cathedral – UK Museums
data.meta_description: Ely Cathedral, also known as the Cathedral Church of the Holy and Undivided Trinity, is a medieval Anglican cathedral located in the city of Ely, Cambridgeshire
data.text:
Ely Cathedral, also known as the Cathedral Church of the Holy and Undivided Trinity, is a medieval Anglican cathedral located in the city of Ely, Cambridgeshire, England.

The cathedral is known for its impressive architecture, including its ornate 14th century octagon tower and the unique “octagon lantern” tower.

The cathedral has a rich history, with parts of the building dating back to the 11th century.

Inside the cathedral, visitors can see a variety of interesting features, including:

The Octagon Tower: Visitors can climb the stairs of the Octagon Tower to enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding area and to see the unique “octagon lantern” tower.

The Lady Chapel: This part of the cathedral is home to beautiful 14th century stained glass windows and an ornate altarpiece.

The Quire: This area of the cathedral is home to some of the finest medieval carvings in England, including the “Ely Angels” and the “Ely Choir stalls”

The Nave: Visitors can admire the impressive architectural features of the nave and its high ceilings, as well as the beautiful stained glass windows.

The Treasury: This room contains a collection of precious metalwork, vestments, and other items of historical interest, including the “Ely Cathedral Copes” and a 12th century gilded cross.

The Ely Cathedral Clock: One of the oldest working mechanical clocks in the world, the clock dates back to the 14th century and is located in the south transept.

The Ely Cathedral Museum: Located in the cathedral’s south transept, it is home to a variety of interesting artefact’s, including the famous “Ely Psalter” and a “Roman Mosaic”.

The Stained Glass: The Cathedral has a collection of beautiful stained glass windows, including the 14th century “Great East Window” and the “Five Sisters” window.

Ely Cathedral cafe is located in the Cathedral’s Undercroft and is open to visitors year-round. The cafe serves a variety of hot and cold drinks, sandwiches, cakes, and other snacks. It is a perfect spot to take a break from your visit and enjoy the peaceful surroundings of the Cathedral. The cafÃ© also offers outdoor seating in the summer months.

The cafÃ© is adjacent to the Cathedral shop, where you can purchase souvenirs and gifts, such as books, postcards, and other items related to the Cathedral and its history.

Ely Cathedral is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is considered one of the finest examples of Gothic architecture in Europe.
